Kup:

Kup nodded and said "sit down my friend this is a large tale "


From=
: Sandy 
Sent: Saturday, March 13, 2010 10:10 PM
To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com=
 
Subject: Re: Back to the Ark


  
OOC: I guess my wireless connection cra=
pped out on me before I got it. Sorry, has a habit of doing that. 

BIC: 

=
The faint voice had raised a very important point. Was he ready to face the=
 answers come what may. He smiles and makes room for Lord Elder beside him.=
 A very gentile look comes over his face.

" A voice asked me a very import=
ant question. A question about self worth, and how my choices define me. I =
admit, it's a hard one to answer. Because to me Lord Elder, innocent lives =
are worth far more than my own. I don't lust for power, instead, I wish for=
 it to be shared with those who desperately need it. So yes, if I had to di=
e for the innocent, I would. I would risk my life to save those of others. =
So my self worth... My self worth can never compare to the lives of future =
generations who depend on those who are willing to put their hearts into fi=
ghting for them. And if I could do something that could make a definite dif=
ference, it would be to help the Decepticons who have been abandoned by the=
ir so called faction, and try to give them a sense of belonging. Good or ev=
il, Decepticon, Predacon, Autobot or Maximal all lives are precious and can=
 never hold a price to them."

He puts a hand on Lord Elder's Shoulder.

" =
That goes for you too, Lord Elder."

He then turns to Kup.

" Yes Kup, I'd =
really like to know how this all happened. Only then can I get a better und=
erstanding as to why Rodimus was unable to resist the enemy." 

He turns hi=
s attention back to Lord Elder.

" I wish I didn't have to wait so long for=
 Optimus to re awaken. But a voice just gave me the advice I've been meanin=
g to hear for a long time. Ughhh.... Uh ohh, energy's down again. I - think=
 I need a recharge.

He stumbles while getting to his feet.

--- In nbwrpg@=
yahoogroups.com, Preston Carroll <supercyclonus@...> wrote:
>
> >
> > " I d=
o promise you something Optimus Prime, even through thoughts of betrayal, I=
 will never turn a blind eye on my Autobot comrade, even though, anger almo=
st made me think otherwise. I have to curb my temper, I'm aware of that. Un=
less I know the story from Rodimus's point of view I will not judge him as =
you have taught me. Innocent until proven guilty. Well, that's about it Opt=
imus, I haven't much more to tell you or to ask of you. May you rest peacef=
ully in the arms of Primus himself."
> >
> > He gets back up onto his feet,=
 and salutes Optimus Prime.
> 
> The large body body of Optimus Prime conti=
nued to lay there as cold
> and lifeless as it has always been. The Maximal=
s and Autobots are tiny
> compared to their massive forms. Nothing moves in=
 this chamber except
> the Maximals and Autobots, and sound itself seems du=
ll and colorless.
> It is a mausoleum to victory and death, and the futilit=
y of both.
> 
> "Freedom creates the opportunity for choice, yet not all ch=
oices can
> be easily discerned." came a whisper, one that only Tuscon coul=
d hear.
> "Our choices are often made according to our sense of our own wor=
th.
> Young Tuscon, what are you worth? How do your choices define you?"
> =

> "Somethings still lie beyond your ability to see.You may find your
> ans=
wers more perplexing than your questions." It is almost as if hands
> were =
laid on Tuscon's shoulders, "Are you ready for it for the answers
> you wil=
l recieve?"
> 
> The sensation of hands fade into nothing, "You are almost =
there Tuscon, rest."
> 
> Lord Elder walked up as the voice faded from Tusc=
on, he looked over at
> Optimus, not quite daring to lay a hand on a foot n=
early as large as
> he was. "He will rise again. It is unfortunate that it =
won't be for so
> many years."
> 
> (TAG)
> 
> OOC: Sandy, I sent you an of=
fline question as well :)
> 
> Preston
>
